articles.title: Massachusetts emergency room wait times rank among the longest in the U.S.
articles.description:
Patients spend an average of 189 minutes — more than three hours — in the emergency department, and longer stays have become more common. What was your experience like?

The post Massachusetts emergency room wait times rank among the longest in the U.S. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patients in Massachusetts wait an average of 189 minutes in emergency rooms.
Longer emergency room stays have become increasingly common across the state.
Boston residents may face delays in receiving urgent medical care due to these wait times.

articles.title: Report: Retired 5x Pro Bowl left-tackle offers to help train Will Campbell
articles.description:
Terron Armstead said Campbell's technique could use some work and volunteered to help him.

The post Report: Retired 5x Pro Bowl left-tackle offers to help train Will Campbell appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Terron Armstead, a retired Pro Bowl left-tackle, offers training to Will Campbell.
Armstead identifies areas for improvement in Campbell's technique as he prepares for the NFL.
This mentorship could enhance Campbell's performance for the New England Patriots in upcoming seasons.

articles.title: More than 400 readers voted: $240K in-office Boston job or $120K remote?
articles.description:
Is doubling your salary worth giving up remote flexibility — especially in a city like Boston?

The post More than 400 readers voted: $240K in-office Boston job or $120K remote? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Over 400 Boston readers voted on job salary preferences between in-office and remote work.
Respondents faced a choice between a $240K in-office job and a $120K remote position.
The debate highlights local concerns about salary versus work-life balance in Boston's job market.

articles.title: City councilor calls for restrictions on e-bikes and mopeds, including ban for food delivery drivers
articles.description:
Councilor Ed Flynn argued that e-bikes and other two-wheeled vehicles, often used by delivery drivers, pose a significant public health threat.

The post City councilor calls for restrictions on e-bikes and mopeds, including ban for food delivery drivers appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Councilor Ed Flynn proposes e-bike and moped restrictions in Boston.
Proposed ban specifically targets food delivery drivers using these vehicles.
Concerns raised about public health threats from increased two-wheeled traffic.

articles.title: Wakefield’s Jessie Diggins fights injury to take bronze in race dominated by Sweden at Milan Cortina Games
articles.description:
“I need a new body. Honestly, I think I’m the happiest, most grateful bronze medalist in the whole world."

The post Wakefield’s Jessie Diggins fights injury to take bronze in race dominated by Sweden at Milan Cortina Games appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Wakefield's Jessie Diggins won a bronze medal at the Milan Cortina Games.
Diggins expressed gratitude despite battling injuries during the competition.
Her achievement boosts local pride and inspires Boston athletes.
